basics.name: Ryan T. Woo
basics.label: PhD Student in Computer Science
basics.summary: Computer Science PhD student at Arizona State University researching intelligent tutoring and adaptive learning systems, human-computer interaction, and immersive educational technology.

education.institution: Arizona State University – School of Computing and Augmented Intelligence
courses: Committee Co-chairs: Ricardo Eiris (SSEBE) and Chris Bryan (SCAI)

education.institution: Arizona State University – SCAI & School of Mathematical and Statistical Sciences
education.area: B.S. in Computer Science with a Minor in Mathematics
courses: School of Computing and Augmented Intelligence
School of Mathematical and Statistical Sciences

work.company: Arizona State University – Construction Workforce and Technology (CWT) Lab
work.summary: Develop learning analytics and immersive training tools that model learner engagement across NSF-funded projects.
highlights: HCC: NSF Grant 2436881 – Modeling Learning Engagement Using AI and Gaze Data to Improve VR Immersive Training
CUE-T: NSF Grant 2434429 – Addressing Hidden Curricula within Computer Science Education
iVisit: NSF Grant 2336507 – Situated Learning Experiences through Web-based Virtual Field Trips

work.company: Arizona State University – IoT and Robotics Education Lab
work.position: Project Management Assistant & Research Software Engineer
work.summary: Lead development of AI-enabled educational platforms and coordinate multi-investigator collaborations.
highlights: Jupyter Textbooks – Extending JupyterLab into an edge-powered interactive textbook platform
RASQAL – Retrieval augmented schema-based question generation for adaptive learning
SAGE – Student Assistant for Guided Explanations (formerly ASU Instructor Assistant GPT)

work.company: Arizona State University – Sensable Heatscapes and Digital Environments (SHaDE) Lab
work.summary: Investigate human thermal exposure and heat resilience using computer vision, visualization, and urban analytics.
highlights: OpenMRT: NSF Grant CMMI-1942805 – Human Thermal Exposure in Cities through novel sensing and modeling

work.summary: Delivered teaching and learning infrastructure for a private K–12 institution.
highlights: Migrated the school to Canvas LMS with SSO integration and end-to-end course content transition
Initiated a Python, Django, and PostgreSQL student information system for records, enrollment, and transcripts

volunteer.organization: Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) Student Chapter at ASU
highlights: Organized the chapter’s first student research symposium

volunteer.organization: SCAI Desert CodeSprouts Workshop for Middle School Children
highlights: Designed and delivered hands-on programming curriculum for middle school learners

volunteer.organization: Engineering Projects in Community Service (EPICS) – Jupyter Textbooks
highlights: Guided multidisciplinary teams extending edge-powered interactive textbook experiences

volunteer.organization: Arizona State University Student Organizations & Outreach
highlights: Judge for EPICS High (2024, 2025) and sunhacks 2024 hackathon
President & Director of Technology, Software Developers Association (SoDA) at ASU – organized InnovationHacks and Code Challenge events
Project Manager, EPICS Attendance Management System (Spring 2023–Fall 2024)
